hi: i burned an 8.04 iso image on a cd, but there's no autoload when rebooting the computer
how can I start the installation?
You probably need to adjust your BIOS boot list
The CD is not supposed to be used in windows
You put the CD in and reboot the PC, it will start from the CD
But you may need to adjust the boot priority order
Oh, there is no direct upgrade path from 6.10 to 8.04
You either re-install, or you have to incremental upgrade it to 7.04, then 7.10, then 8.04
yes, that's why i saved all my files and tried to install 8.04
i did as you said, put in the CD and rebooted - but it's not starting from the cd
Like I said, you will need to go into the BIOS and make sure the CD is the first boot prioirity
Have you tried the CD on another computer?
no - maybe I have to set some "boot flags" when burning it to make clear that's supposed to be a boot-cd?
not if you did a direct ISO burn
yes, I did. hm ok.. now, when booting the pc, GRUB starts
